bug.short_desc: Add new unordered list in empty ordered list item does not remove order number

long_desc.thetext:
Reproducable in the Demo: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/contrib/HtmlArea/trunk/demo/default/index.html
Steps to reproduce: 1. Type a few lines 2. Start a numbered list 3. Type a few lines (numbered list items) 4. Press Return to add a new line 5. Click the "Insert Unordered List" button
Expected Result: A new, indented bulleted (unordered) list is created, there is no number at the first line of the indented list
Actual Result: A new indented bulleted list is created, but the number of the last (empty) ordered list item is still there

The correct demo URL is
http://demo.qooxdoo.org/devel/demobrowser/#widget~HtmlArea.html
since this is the newest version of the HtmlArea.
My tests showed that only the IE (at least version 7) has issues with this. Instead of creating a new list the IE 7 does replace all ordered list items with unordered ones. All other browser work correct and showing the expected results.
@Matthias Can you please re-check the steps you described? Maybe there is something missing. Or I'm overlooking something, though.
Discontinued support for htmlarea in the framework, set all open issues to WONTFIX. Still available as a contribution acc. to bug #7918 .
